metadata.Title: CVE-2018-12026 on Ubuntu 22.04 ESM (jammy) - medium
metadata.Description:
During the spawning of a malicious Passenger-managed application,SpawningKit in Phusion Passenger 5.3.x before 5.3.2 allows suchapplications to replace key files or directories in the spawningcommunication directory with symlinks. This then could result in arbitraryreads and writes, which in turn can result in information disclosure andprivilege escalation.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-12026` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-passenger - 6.0.10-3build1
passenger - 6.0.10-3build1
Available with Ubuntu Pro: https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: passenger package in esm-apps/jammy, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '6.0.10-3build1').
